Bash(git commit -m "$\(cat <<''EOF''
Fix subscriber idle disconnect with resilient reconnection loop and gRPC keepalive

Wraps subscriber.StartAsync in a while\(true\) loop that recreates the
SubscriberClient when the connection drops after idle time. Adds gRPC
keepalive pings \(60s interval, 30s timeout\) via SocketsHttpHandler to
prevent idle disconnects. Cleans up old subscriber in finally block.

Co-Authored-By: Claude Opus 4.5 <noreply@anthropic.com>
EOF
\)")

Bash(gh pr create --base master --head latest1 --title "Fix subscriber idle disconnect with resilient reconnection loop and gRPC keepalive" --body "$\(cat <<''EOF''
## Summary
- Wraps `subscriber.StartAsync` in a resilient `while\(true\)` loop that recreates the `SubscriberClient` when the gRPC streaming connection drops after idle time
- Adds gRPC keepalive pings \(60s interval, 30s timeout\) via `SocketsHttpHandler` to prevent idle disconnects
- Cleans up old subscriber in `finally` block before reconnecting to avoid resource leaks
- Bumps version to v1.0.30

## Test plan
- [ ] Deploy and verify subscriber starts and processes messages normally
- [ ] Let the subscriber sit idle for an extended period and confirm it reconnects automatically
- [ ] Verify log output shows reconnection warnings when the subscriber restarts
- [ ] Confirm no duplicate message processing during reconnection

EOF
\)")
